Authors: Luyten, Jeroen; Naci, Huseyin; Knapp, Martin
Article Title: Economic evaluation of mental health interventions: an introduction to cost-utility analysis.
Abstract: Finite resources need to be allocated over an ever-increasing range of competing health policies and interventions. Economic evaluation has been developed as a methodology to inform decision makers on the efficiency of particular resource allocations. In this paper we summarize cost-utility analysis, one of the most widely-used forms of economic evaluation in healthcare. We discuss its main elements, interpretation, limitations and relevance to the domain of mental health.
